conclusion: Four objects on a textured surface with shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
Object A appears to be a small circular cookie or pastry with pink/red topping.
Object B is a small yellow notepad or calendar.
Object C's object isn't clearly visible but has a shadow.
Shadows are currently cast on the surface behind the objects.
When a light source illuminates an object, the shadow forms on the opposite side from the light source.
The shadow's size depends on the distance between the object and the surface, and the distance between the light source and the object.
When the light source moves forward, all shadows will move backward (away from the objects).
When the light source moves forward, all shadows will move further from their respective objects.
When the light source moves closer, all shadows will become larger/longer.
As the light source gets closer, the angle of light rays passing around the object becomes wider, creating a larger shadow.
Shadow A will move backward, further from the cookie, and will become larger.
Shadow B will move backward, further from the notepad, and will become larger.
Shadow C will move backward, further from its object, and will become larger.
Shadow D will move backward, further from the baseball, and will become larger.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will all move backward and increase in size when the light source moves forward.
